result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad Sparrow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: concurrent with Count 2 in 15CF1951 and consecutive to any other sentence; release for work, inmate work assignments, The Day Reporting Center; with credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
For the first year defendant to have a curfew: 9:00 pm to 5:00 am at home with the only exception of providing verified work or school hours.

miscConds.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. Fine set at ZERO.
Maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present.

No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
COUNT 1 ONLY:  For the reasons placed on the record, the Court GRANTED the Defense request for expungement upon successfully completion of probation.

Provide DNA sample, if not already done.
No drivers license suspension imposed.
Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 3 business days/ 72 hours of receiving prescription from medical professional.
Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.

timeConds.notes:
COUNT 1 ONLY:  without goodtime credit; release for ONLY The Day Reporting Center, work,  and inmate work assignments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.  This is stayed to use as follows: 
* First violation of positive drug or alcohol test to serve 7 DAYS.
* Second violation of positive drug or alcohol test to serve 14 DAYS.
*Remaining condition time to be used at the discretion of the agent.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: concurrent with Count 1 in 15CF1951 and consecutive to any other sentence; release for work, inmate work assignments, The Day Reporting Center; with credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

08-28-15/ Carolina M Stark    -
The Court ordered that the Probation term on Count 2 is commuted to one year.

miscConds.notes:
See Count 1 for other conditions.

COUNT 2 ONLY:  For the reasons placed on the record, the Court DENIED the Defense request for expungement upon successfully completion of probation.

Reflects 08-28-15 Court order to commute Probation term on Count 2 to 1 year.
Order Commuting Probation Term received, signed,and filed with court.

DOC request to clarify probationary term on count two.

Defendant Chad Sparrow in court with attorney Jamie J LaVora.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction concurrent with Count 2 in 15CF1951 and consecutive to any other sentence; release for work, inmate work assignments, The Day Reporting Center; with credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

 Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done.
- No drivers license suspension imposed.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
- For the reasons placed on the record, the Court GRANTED the Defense request for expungement upon successfully completion of probation.
- Court ordered defendant to serve 4 MONTHS CONDITION TIME  in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release for ONLY The Day Reporting Center, work,  and inmate work assignments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.  This is stayed to use as follows: 
* First violation of positive drug or alcohol test to serve 7 DAYS.
* Second violation of positive drug or alcohol test to serve 14 DAYS.
*Remaining condition time to be used at the discretion of the agent. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 24 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 2 - 
Court ordered defendant to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction concurrent with Count 1 in 15CF1951 and consecutive to any other sentence; release for work, inmate work assignments, The Day Reporting Center; with credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done.
- No drivers license suspension imposed.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
- For the reasons placed on the record, the Court DENIED the Defense request for expungement upon successfully completion of probation.

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 24 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 3 business days/ 72 hours of receiving prescription from medical professional.
- Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
 - No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present. 
- Maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both. 
- For the first year defendant to have a curfew: 9:00 pm to 5:00 am at home with the only exception of providing verified work or school hours. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;

Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;

Defendant Chad Sparrow in court with attorney Jamie J LaVora.  Paul Hauer on behalf of Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE. Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time. Court REITERATES that the defendant is under all conditions in bail, which includes absolute sobriety. Case remains calendared for 08-14-2015 on 01:30 pm in Branch 17.

Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report: Drug Test: Positive received and filed. tk 
Court will address report 07/27/2015 at 1:30 pm.
Letter on behalf of defendant received and filed. tk

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Arguments heard as to bail. Cash Bond  Bond Set at $100.00.  Court amends conditions.  Parties notified that effective August 1, 2015, Branch 17 will be located in the Safety Building, room 310.

Defendant Chad Sparrow in court with attorney Jamie J LaVora.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.

AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2 :

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Case proceeded to sentencing. Case passed. Case recalled and Court placed in chambers discussion on the record. Case proceed to bail/bond hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Chad Sparrow in court with attorney Jamie J LaVora.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
  Defense counsel received discovery and offer. Court notes no objection to 15CM404 case being transferred to Branch 17 if Court approves. Court orders case for adjourned Plea and Sentencing, Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Chad Sparrow in court with attorney Jamie J LaVora. Partricia Daugherty for Karl Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-26-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chad Sparrow in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Chad Sparrow not in court.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
